DOC.brief_summary: Urinary tract infections occurs in trauma. We investigate whether a nitrofurazone coated can reduce the number of urinary tract infections.
DOC.brief_title: Does a Nitrofurazone Coated Bladder Catheter Reduce the Number of Urinary Tract Infections in Trauma
DOC.detailed_description: Urinary tract infection occurs in one in five patients as a complication following severe trauma. A new and approved urinary bladder catheter (Releen NF) has been introduced by the Danish company Coloplast A/S. Releen NF is expected to reduce the number of urinary tract infections, but this effect has not been investigated in trauma patients.
DOC.criteria: Clinical suspicion of multiple trauma Age >/= 18 years Direct referral from scene of accident Indication for urinary bladder catherization Major burn injury HIV positiv Pregnancy
